module1_intro.title: Module 1 - The Robotic Nervous System
module1_intro.description: Welcome to Module 1 of the Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics book. This module provides a comprehensive introduction to ROS 2 and humanoid robotics, focusing on creating AI-robot interfaces using the "athena" humanoid robot model (23-DoF).

module2/intro.title: Module 2 Introduction
module2/intro.description: Welcome to Module 2 of the Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics textbook. This module focuses on creating digital twins of robotic systems through advanced simulation techniques. You'll learn to master physics engines, implement realistic sensors, create photorealistic rendering, and generate synthetic datasets for AI training.

module3/intro.title: Module 3 Introduction
module3/intro.description: Welcome to Module 3 of the Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics textbook. This module focuses on creating advanced AI-robot brains using NVIDIA's Isaac Platform. You'll learn to master Isaac Sim 2025.2, implement hardware-accelerated perception with Isaac ROS 2, integrate navigation and manipulation systems, train reinforcement learning policies with Isaac Lab, and execute sim-to-real transfer.

module3/README.title: Module 3: The AI-Robot Brain – NVIDIA Isaac Platform
module3/README.description: Welcome to Module 3 of the Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics textbook. This module focuses on creating advanced AI-robot brains using NVIDIA's Isaac Platform. You'll learn to master Isaac Sim 2025.2, implement hardware-accelerated perception with Isaac ROS 2, integrate navigation and manipulation systems, train reinforcement learning policies with Isaac Lab, and execute sim-to-real transfer.

module4/intro.title: Module 4: Vision-Language-Action Models – From Voice to Physical Action
module4/intro.description: Welcome to Module 4 of the Physical AI and Humanoid Robotics textbook. This module focuses on Vision-Language-Action (VLA) models - systems that can understand natural language commands, perceive their environment visually, and execute appropriate physical actions.
